p: Phylogenetic reconstructions based on nucleotide (and deduced amino acid) sequence alignments are generally possible with selected genes of relatively close viruses (i.e., that belong to the same family). The main methods used to derive evolutionary trees are: maximum parsimony, distance, ML, Bayesian methods of phylogenetic inference, and splits-tree analysis [reviewed in ( Eigen, 1992, Page and Holmes, 1998, Mount, 2004, Salemi and Vandamme, 2004, Sullivan, 2005, Holmes, 2008, Beale et al., 2018, Geoghegan and Holmes, 2018)] ( Table 7.3).
